“Sol y Canto’s 15th Birthday” All-Ages Concert and Rosi and Brian Amador’s 25th Musical Anniversary Celebration. - Quinceañero de Sol y Canto - `¡Están Invitados!

NEWS FLASH! ¡Gran Noticia! Our dear friend, Colombian Composer of "vallenatos" FERNANDO DANGOND CASTRO will join Sol y Canto on Accordion on his original, renowned song, "Nació mi Poesía," recorded by Sol y Canto on their 1994 debut album! Come check out Fernando's beautiful song and his fabulous accordion sound so typical of his native Valledupar in Colombia!

Performance to take place on Sunday, December 6 at 3:00-4:30pm. Admission is FREE and open to the public; open seating. The Cambridge Public Library’s beautiful new Lecture Hall has a capacity of 230 seats and is an acoustical gem designed by William Rawn, architect of Seiji Ozawa Hall (Tanglewood). It is handicapped accessible and there is FREE underground parking. It is located at 449 Broadway, Cambridge.




Note that after the Library's official closing time, from 5-6pm, Sol y Canto's private After-Party for Fans Begins! By Reservation Only! or Call 1-8-0-0- 838-3006 to Reserve NOW by Phone. Enjoy a Latin Buffet and two dessert flans from La Casa de Pedro Restaurant (¡Delicioso!) with members of Sol y Canto, and the Boston debut of some new live musical compositions only for our party attendees! For a sneak preview of all the celebratory activities on Dec. 6th, visit www.solycanto.com



FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE: Boston Music Award Winners and “TuBoston 2009” Winners, Sol y Canto, along with special guest singers Alisa and Sonia Amador, twin daughters of founders Rosi and Brian Amador, take the stage for Sol y Canto’s 15th Anniversary celebration and for Rosi and Brian Amador’s 25th anniversary as pan-Latin music ambassadors touring the U.S. and abroad. As part of the new green Cambridge Public Library’s Main Branch inaugural season, this special celebration will feature songs from their most recent critically acclaimed CD for adults, Cada Día un Regalo, selections from their bilingual Parents’ Choice Award-winning CD, El Doble de Amigos/Twice as Many Friends, and the unveiling of a new song from “SABOR Y MEMORIA (Flavor and Memory): A Musical Feast in Seven Courses”, the group’s suite-in-progress about Latin food, identity, memory, immigration, slow food and hunger. The suite was composed this past winter by guitarist/musical director Brian Amador, during a fellowship at the MacDowell Artist Colony in Peterborough, NH for Sol y Canto and string quartet, and begins touring nationally in February 2010.

The heart and soul of Sol y Canto’s music is its lush vocal harmonies, sumptuous Spanish guitar and a combination of Latin rhythms and beautiful ballads performed with excitement and enthusiasm. Led by New Mexican guitarist/composer Brian Amador, along with Puerto Rican/Argentine singer/percussionist, Rosi Amador, and accompanied by top musicians from Panama, Uruguay, Perú and the U.S. Sol y Canto’s concerts have brought audiences to their feet from Symphony Hall, the Kennedy Center and White House to the Philadelphia Art Museum, the California World Music Festival, the Vancouver Folk Festival, and Puerto Rico’s Museo de Arte. This show also includes the special participation of young violinist Mayrení Morel of the Dominican Republic.




Musicians
Rosi Amador (Puerto Rico/Argentina) - lead vocal, bongos
Brian Amador (New Mexico) - guitar, composer
Jorge Roeder (Peru) - bass
Nando Michelin (Uruguay) - piano
Renato Thoms (Panama) - percussion
Tim Mayer (Portland, OR) - sax, flute
And special guest: Mayreni Morel (Dominican Republic)- violin

Very Special Guests
Alisa & Sonia Amador, (Boston, MA) – 13 year old twins
